subject: Add factory reset page
commitMessage:
Add factory reset page

- Adds a factory reset page with the majority of layout and
user flows in place.

Signed-off-by: Suren Neware <sneware9@in.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I50a5912617d6dfb12d82bbcc632ced565652a56b

Patch Set 20:

Please abandon. Thank you!

Abandoned

Work being done in https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/webui-vue/+/40773

We need two different buttons. This is not the design. I have posted in Slack, but I feel the actions should be clear to what will happen and not seem like a confirmation validation.

For hypervisor rest only: Reset hypervisor settings only
For reset all: Reset BMC and hypervisor settings
This got already replaced with what you have posted on Slack.
Misspelling of hypervisor
Done.
confused by this store and what we are attempting to do here...the API requests here should be the actions to reset the settings....
Done. Forgot to remove that. It wasn't completed.
Can be removed
Done.

This is not semantic markup.Using it in this case seems like a presentational use of a page heading.HTML headings should not skip levels. To make this semantic, my suggestion is:

Reset BMC and hypervisor settings

{{ $t('pageFactoryReset.alert.message') }}
Done. But the 'strong' tag has higher font weight than given in mockup. And not sure how 'p' tag can wrap 'div' tag which will break semantic meaning.

Why a
and not a

element?
Because <div> is a generic block level container.
This is not semantic and also does not match the layout.
Done. I used <div> tag and added 'h4' class to match layout.
The mock up has an icon. If we are proposing not to use one, we should discuss with the design team.
Done. Added icon.
not sure what this is
Done. Removed.
it looks like this action is attempting to perform the reset action, not sure why it would be called immediately
Removed. Thought to keep ready.
Misspelling of hypervisor
Done

instead of pulling in this built in validator, you will just want create a custom validator to validate that the value is true (if host on–could use requiredIf for this)
https://vuelidate.js.org/#custom-validators
Working.
Saw your comment on slack, No issue with validation code.

Here is an example of a similar flow 
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/webui-vue/+/38855/6/src/env/components/Dumps/DumpsModalConfirmation.vue#52

Could you try something similar?
Done. I went through it and modified the modal.
Could you set up the store with the correct API calls? There should be two actions, one to reset all settings and one to reset bios/hypervisor only
Working
what does this do?
It helps to hide Reset All Setting button when i am clicking on Reset Hypervisor Setting button.
are you showing the same modal as the method above?
Yes. Hence different method for switching button.
we can pull in the StatusIcon component instead
Not sure how to get warning alt variation icon.
should maybe rename to something like resetConfirmation
Done

Kindly change the action name as this is going to reset the machine.
ex. resetBMC, or anything else suggestion from you @Derick.
Done. Changed the action name.
We can call a promise and show a few seconds delays and show the toast message, just to make sure our end to end code is working.
Done. I enabled same and commented out api call.
Can you update to 'an'? cause an unrecoverable error.
Done
I don't think we need to change the look and feel for list elements. Please remove after discussing with the design team, if they agree.
Ack
extra space
Done. Removed. Not sure how does it missed in presence of prettier.

this naming convention doesn't match how we've named other items in the json file

maybe rename resetHostDescription
Done

this naming convention doesn't match how we've named other items in the json file

maybe rename resetBmcAndHostDescription?
Done

this naming convention doesn't match how we've named other items in the json file

maybe rename resetHost
Done
resetBmcAndHost
Done
not sure this is specific enough of a name. I'm not sure what condition means.
Done. Named as 'resetCondition'.
Done. I went through first option.
Needs to be added to the IBM routing as well or it does not show up on the IBM build.
Not sure it should show up on the IBM build. Better what you suggest.
These need to be uncommented
Done
need to uncomment
Done
